java/liquibase/change/UpdateDataChange.java

00001 package liquibase.change;
00002 
00003 import liquibase.database.Database;
00004 import liquibase.database.sql.SqlStatement;
00005 import liquibase.database.sql.UpdateStatement;
00006 import liquibase.database.structure.DatabaseObject;
00007 import liquibase.database.structure.Table;
00008 import liquibase.exception.UnsupportedChangeException;
00009 import liquibase.exception.InvalidChangeDefinitionException;
00010 import liquibase.util.StringUtils;
00011 import org.w3c.dom.Document;
00012 import org.w3c.dom.Element;
00013 
00014 import java.util.*;
00015 
00016 public class UpdateDataChange extends AbstractChange implements ChangeWithColumns {
00017 
00018     private String schemaName;
00019     private String tableName;
00020     private List<ColumnConfig> columns;
00021     private String whereClause;
00022 
00023     public UpdateDataChange() {
00024         super("update", "Update Data");
00025         columns = new ArrayList<ColumnConfig>();
00026     }
00027 
00028     public String getSchemaName() {
00029         return schemaName;
00030     }
00031 
00032     public void setSchemaName(String schemaName) {
00033         this.schemaName = StringUtils.trimToNull(schemaName);
00034     }
00035 
00036     public String getTableName() {
00037         return tableName;
00038     }
00039 
00040     public void setTableName(String tableName) {
00041         this.tableName = tableName;
00042     }
00043 
00044     public List<ColumnConfig> getColumns() {
00045         return columns;
00046     }
00047 
00048     public void setColumns(List<ColumnConfig> columns) {
00049         this.columns = columns;
00050     }
00051 
00052     public void addColumn(ColumnConfig column) {
00053         columns.add(column);
00054     }
00055 
00056     public void removeColumn(ColumnConfig column) {
00057         columns.remove(column);
00058     }
00059 
00060     public String getWhereClause() {
00061         return whereClause;
00062     }
00063 
00064     public void setWhereClause(String whereClause) {
00065         this.whereClause = whereClause;
00066     }
00067 
00068     public void validate(Database database) throws InvalidChangeDefinitionException {
00069         if (StringUtils.trimToNull(tableName) == null) {
00070             throw new InvalidChangeDefinitionException("tableName is required", this);
00071         }
00072 
00073         for (ColumnConfig column : getColumns()) {
00074             if (StringUtils.trimToNull(column.getName()) == null) {
00075                 throw new InvalidChangeDefinitionException("column name is required", this);
00076             }
00077         }
00078     }
00079     
00080     public SqlStatement[] generateStatements(Database database) throws UnsupportedChangeException {
00081 
00082         UpdateStatement statement = new UpdateStatement(getSchemaName() == null?database.getDefaultSchemaName():getSchemaName(), getTableName());
00083 
00084         for (ColumnConfig column : columns) {
00085             statement.addNewColumnValue(column.getName(), column.getValueObject());
00086         }
00087 
00088         statement.setWhereClause(whereClause);
00089 
00090         return new SqlStatement[]{
00091                 statement
00092         };
00093     }
00094 
00095     public String getConfirmationMessage() {
00096         return "Data updated in " + getTableName();
00097     }
00098 
00099     public Element createNode(Document currentChangeLogFileDOM) {
00100         Element node = currentChangeLogFileDOM.createElement("update");
00101         if (getSchemaName() != null) {
00102             node.setAttribute("schemaName", getSchemaName());
00103         }
00104 
00105         node.setAttribute("tableName", getTableName());
00106 
00107         for (ColumnConfig col : getColumns()) {
00108             Element subNode = col.createNode(currentChangeLogFileDOM);
00109             node.appendChild(subNode);
00110         }
00111 
00112         if (StringUtils.trimToNull(getWhereClause()) != null) {
00113             Element whereClause = currentChangeLogFileDOM.createElement("where");
00114             whereClause.appendChild(currentChangeLogFileDOM.createTextNode(getWhereClause()));
00115             node.appendChild(whereClause);
00116         }
00117         return node;
00118     }
00119 
00120     public Set<DatabaseObject> getAffectedDatabaseObjects() {
00121         Table dbObject = new Table(getTableName());
00122 
00123         return new HashSet<DatabaseObject>(Arrays.asList(dbObject));
00124     }
00125 
00126 }
